720946f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 31st Street
720946f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue at N. W. corner of 31st Street.
February 23, 1931.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
Ncg. 1R1
THE NEw yOEE
PUBLC LIBRARY

711995f-a.title: Manhattan: 31st Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
711995f-a.text:
137 East 3lst Street, adjoining the N.E. corner of Lexington Ave.,
showing a structure which in conjunction with Nos. 181-187 Lexington
Ave., will be demolished and replaced with a modern 6-story apartment
house.
September 18, 1937.
George D. Chinn.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720947f-b.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 31st Street (East)
720947f-b.text:
195 to 179 Lexington Ave., east side, south from East 32nd to 31st
Streets, showing a row of 4-story structures that will be demolished
for a new 6-story apartment house. This will not include the far
corner building, No. 179, which will remain. The structures to be
razed are Nos. 187 to 181.
September 18, 1937.
George D. Chinn.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
179 to 183 Lexington Ave. (left), at, adjoining and north of the
N.E. corner of East 31st Street, showing two buildings which will
be included in a demolition for a new 6-story apartment house. The
corner structure, No. 179, will remain. Between the latter and the
garage (No. 139-147 East 31st Street) is a 4-story private house,
set back from the street front that will be included in this new
construction. It is No. 137 and does not appear; being obscured
by the corner structure.
September 18, 1937.

711996f-a.title: Manhattan: 31st Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
711996f-a.text:
East 31st Street, at and adjoining the N. W. corner
of Lexington Avenue. The buildings shown bear No's. 127
to 131 East 31at Street. The corner structure is No. 180
Lexington Avenue. The Avenue is at the right.
1940
George D. Chinn
NO REPIODUCTIONS
